name: Approach
description: An approach is an implementation of automatic detection of a violation against the formal rule which the quality attribute entails.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of proposed solution classifies an approach regarding the general paradigm utilized to implement a detection algorithm.

characteristics.description: Violations against the quality attribute are detected based on a static set of predefined rules.
The detection of violations against the quality attribute is realized through a supervised machine learning approach.
The detection of violations against the quality attribute is realized through an unsupervised machine learning approach.
The detection of violations against the quality attribute is realized through a supervised deep learning approach.
The detection of violations against the quality attribute is realized through an unsupervised deep learning approach.

attributes.name: accessibility
attributes.description: The accessibility classifies an approach regarding the degree to which it is available.

characteristics.description: The approach is hosted in a service that satisfies all of the following criteria: (1) Immutable URL: cannot be altered by the author or someone else, (2) Permanent: the hosting organization has a mission to maintain artefacts for the foreseeable future, (3) Accessible: There is a DOI pointing to the real approach URL, (4) Open-Source License: The approach has a proper licence which grants access and re-use of data, material, and source code
The approach is available for all to use and the codebase has been disclosed
The approach is reachable now, but is missing some aspect above to be considered Open Access.
A link is given in paper, but does not resolve.
An approach is discussed, but no link is provided.
Authors say the approach is available upon request.
The authors say that an approach exists, but is private for some reasons (such as industry collaboration with private data, etc.)
The approach is available but proprietary

attributes.name: source link
attributes.description: The source or link is the pointer towards the location where the object can be found.

attributes.name: empirical method applied
attributes.description: This dimension determines whether an approach has been evaluated with some sort of empirical method: this can be a formal experiment comparing the efficiency of the approach, but may also appear in the form of interviews confirming the findings of the approach.

characteristics.description: An empirical method has been applied to validate the approach.
The approach has simply been postulated without any empirical validation.

attributes.name: practitioners involved
attributes.description: This dimension captures whether the application/evaluation of the approach involved actual practitioners. We currently do not differentiate whether the practitioners involved with the evaluation were also the practitioners who worked with the data set used for the evaluation.

characteristics.description: The evaluation of the approach involved practitioners, which primarily work in industry.
The evaluation of the approach involved no practitioners (hence instead: authors, research staff, students, etc.).

attributes.name: releases
attributes.description: The relase classifies an approach regarding the type of solution that was disclosed to the public. While some approaches are disclosed in the form of executable tools, also publishing the source code in order to improve reuse and maintainance shall be encouraged.

dimensions.description: A online interface hosted as a webservice
The source code of the approach
A pre-trained model (resulting from an ML/DL solution)

characteristics.description: has been released
has not been released

attributes.name: necessary information
attributes.description: The necessary information classifies an approach regarding the type of information that needs to be available in order to automatically determine a violation against the formal rule.
attributes.extraction rule: To automatically determine a violation against the formal rule of the quality factor,

dimensions.description: an association of each token with its corresponding part-of-speech tag
an association of each token with the token it depends on
an association of each token with its parenting constituent
an association of each token with its lemmatized form
an association of each token with its word stem

is unclear whether it is necessary
is not necessary
